document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Campsicnemus fumipennis group (Diptera: Dolichopodidae) in the Hawaiian Islands, with descriptions of new species and corrections of misidentifications

, M.R. Wheeler ( UHM ).

Etymology. The specific epithet derives from a combination of the Latin, spectabilis = “showy, notable” + fabulous, from the Latin fabulor = “story, tale”, in reference to the fabulous and showy wing and abdominal pattern and strikingly hirsute male mid tibia.

Remarks. The biology of this species [as “
C. fumipennis
”] and its immature stages were described in detail by
Williams ( 1938 )
based on specimens observed and collected at Lulumahu Stream. Rearing records of immatures are shown in
Table 1
. One prey record is found on one label from a reared immature feeding on a species of the drosophilid
Dettopsomyia
at Makaleha, O‘ahu.
